normalised: **five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The phased rollout of 5G services across India continues to gather steam, with major telecom operators Airtel and Jio announcing expansions in key metropolitan areas. As of 20/10/2024, Jio claims to have covered 85% of Mumbai with its 5G network, while Airtel focuses on expanding its reach in the National Capital Region, including Gurugram and Noida.
normalised: New Delhi – The phased rollout of five G services across India continues to gather steam, with major telecom operators Airtel and Jio announcing expansions in key metropolitan areas. As of twentieth october two thousand and twenty four, Jio claims to have covered eighty five percent of Mumbai with its five G network, while Airtel focuses on expanding its reach in the National Capital Region, including Gurugram and Noida.

unnormalised: Industry analysts predict that the complete nationwide rollout will be achieved by Q1 2025, unlocking significant opportunities for various sectors, including healthcare, education, and manufacturing. The government's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme is incentivizing local manufacturing of 5G equipment, aiming to reduce dependence on foreign vendors.
normalised: Industry analysts predict that the complete nationwide rollout will be achieved by Q one two thousand and twenty five, unlocking significant opportunities for various sectors, including healthcare, education, and manufacturing. The government's Production Linked Incentive (P L I) scheme is incentivizing local manufacturing of five G equipment, aiming to reduce dependence on foreign vendors.

unnormalised: "We are committed to providing seamless 5G connectivity to all Indians," stated Mr. Sharma, Director General of the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI), during a press conference held at 11:00 hrs today. He added that TRAI is working diligently to address concerns regarding call drops and network stability. Bharti Enterprises recently announced an investment of Rs. 5000 crore to improve 5G infrastructure in rural areas by 15/08/2025. The adoption of 5G is expected to boost the Indian economy, fostering innovation and creating new avenues for growth.
normalised: "We are committed to providing seamless five G connectivity to all Indians," stated Mister Sharma, Director General of the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I), during a press conference held at eleven zero zero hours today. He added that T R A I is working diligently to address concerns regarding call drops and network stability. Bharti Enterprises recently announced an investment of rupees five thousand crore to improve five G infrastructure in rural areas by fifteenth august two thousand and twenty five. The adoption of five G is expected to boost the Indian economy, fostering innovation and creating new avenues for growth.
